fanin 50, 40127 bologna, italy d arpa-simc‚Äîenvironmental protection agency of emilia-romagna, hydrometeoclimate service, v.le silvani, 6, 40122 bologna, italy a r t i c l e i n f o a b s t r a c t article history: aiming at developing real time water balance modelling for irrigation scheduling, this study assesses received 15 july 2015 the accuracy of the soil water balance model criteria, developed by the hydro-meteorological service received in revised form 2 november 2015 of the emilia-romagna region (italy).
the model consists of (i) an algorithm for coupling the surface accepted 4 november 2015 Ô¨Çow components (i.e.
richards equation), and (ii) various modules which may be applicable to different available online 12 november 2015 topographical and environmental conditions.

in this study, criteria was applied to simulate the soil water balance for an orange orchard in semi-arid mediterranean conditions (eastern sicily, insular italy) keywords: during the cropping season 2011.

soil moisture field scale the model was implemented by varying the evapotranspiration rates (et) as input; et Ô¨Çuxes were evapotranspiration rate estimated by using satellite-based approach and the penman‚Äìmonteith expression for reference rates, model efÔ¨Åciency or were directly measured by the eddy covariance technique and the sap Ô¨Çow heat pulse method for transpiration.
model outputs, in term of soil moisture, were validated with direct measures of volumetric soil water content obtained by time domain reÔ¨Çectrometry (tdr) probes.
results of the study proved the reliability of criteria to reproduce the soil moisture proÔ¨Åle at the experimental site.
the model performance was signiÔ¨Åcantly high when direct measurements of crop water demand were included as input for model application.
the satellite-based approach provided reliable crop evapotranspiration estimates, conÔ¨Årming the utility of the remote sensing techniques as support for water management in agriculture.
